name: Dreams La Romana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from our 3rd Xmas. It has just got better every year. Our room was kept spotlessly clean and there was always clean towels daily. The food was excellent in the World Cafe and in all the other restaurants also. Where else can you go and eat steaks every night? My only complaint if you could call it that was that sometimes the service was not as good this year. There seemed to be fewer waiters than we remembered from other years. Still we were on holiday so not rushing off anywhere. Entertainment from Picasso and his team who all work so hard was as enjoyable as ever. Beach seemed a bit crowded this year but plenty of room at the pools. Will be back this Xmas.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.text: Dreams La Romana Was simply amazing! We went with a group of 17, ages 3-60.
reviews.title: THE BEST HOLIDAY EVER!!

reviews.text: It had everything you could want, From Kids soft drinks to Champagne, Food was plentiful & varied. The staff were excellent, so friendly, Nothing was to much trouble for them,
reviews.title: If you are picky, don't go there

reviews.text: The beach was well looked after, Plenty of sunbeds, fresh fruit on the beach, served by The ever smiling Belkis! & drinks served to you on your lounger by the waitresses!
reviews.title: Outside of the poor food, very nice resort.

reviews.text: Kids clubs were great & safe.
reviews.title: fun, family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We transferred to Dreams La Romana for the last 9 nights of our 16 night stay in the Dominican Republic in November 2010 because we were disappointed with the Bahia Principe La Romana because it was not up to the standard we had enjoyed at other Bahia Principe hotels in the Dom Rep. It cost us a couple of hundred pounds to upgrade to Dreams but it was worth every penny and I would recommend anyone planning to visit the La Romana area in the Dom. Rep. to pay the extra to stay at Dreams.
reviews.title: Excellant Place to stay in La Romana

reviews.text: The quality of the food is excellent and the added benefit of not having to book in order to go to the speciality restaurant was a definite plus. We also took advantage of the room service option when my wife was poorly for a couple of days. It was nice having Diet Coke instead of Pepsi or local brands as well. The food on the beach was excellent for lunch, and the availability of fresh fruit and coconut on the beach was also appreciated.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: There are 2 large pools there - one large pool where most of the activities took place and the other infinity pool which had the pool bar was the more quiet pool which we preferred. Waiter service was also appreciated by the pool which most hotels we have stayed at in the Dom Rep do not have this.
reviews.title: Dreams Do Come True!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in block 5 on the top floor which was fine. The room had been modernized from those that we saw in Block 3 for example and I was glad of this as the other rooms looked a little dated. The only improvement they could have made to the room was including a bath as well as a shower. My wife and I normally only have a shower which was not a problem for us but might be for some.
reviews.title: Amazing - We will definitely be returning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach I thought was nice although some reviewers were not so keen. I quite like the fact that the sand is firm so you can walk easily. There had been a tropical storm close by and so the sea was quite murky for a few days but after this the sea became very clear and was great for snorkeling as there was some nice fish around the rocks about 200m off shore which were easy to swim to. I used, the Catarmarans as often as I could BUT BEWARE, what breeze there was, was going off shore (which the guys running the Aquatic Centre said was the norm) and so as you came back in towards shore, about 50m out the wind just drops because of the palm trees etc sheltering the beach which makes it VERY hard to make that last 50m. On strong wind days no problems. It took me 45 mins to cover that last 50m one day and that was with giving up trying to catch any wind and eventually getting off the catermeran and swimming/towing it to shore. Not the end of the world though and added to the fun of the holiday. The Germans waiting to use the Catermeran next though were not amused that I had used up 30 minutes of their allotted time – still, if they were that bothered they could have swam out and helped me pull it in. Heh Ho!!!
reviews.title: Genuinely warm smiles from wonderful people, feels like home to us!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This review is a little late since we were there for two weeks, Oct 24th to Nov 7th, 2010. During this time, we experienced the brush by of a hurricane that hit Haiti and Cuba before heading north. The weather stayed warm and we had more showers late in the day with the most rain occurring one day around 3pm that poured until late in the evening. We really enjoyed the covered walkways between buildings that allowed us to stay dry while walking from our room to the restaurants and bars. Frankly, the weather did not dampen our visit, but it did stop our snorkling around the resort since the incoming waves did stir up the sand. I did notice the prevailing winds blow offshore so there is usually not a lot of wave action on the shore.
reviews.title: Loved it so much, we are already booked to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Good premises, bad food

reviews.text: We enjoyed an Ocean front honeymoon suite in building #5. The suite had a living room with dining table and two piece bath with the bedroom having a king bed with a massive ensuite that included a two man Jacuzzi, large open shower, large sink area with a separate sit down make up counter. You could gain access to the front patio from patio doors from the living room area and the bedroom area. While nice to sit out and enjoy the views and breakfast, the furnishings are sparce and it would be nice to have at least two loungers out there.
reviews.title: Dreams hotel nearly lives up to its hype

reviews.text: Preferred extras:
reviews.title: wont be going back this is not dreams standards

reviews.text: This is our 4th Dreams resort and we feel the Preferred package at this resort does allow you some “bang for your buck”. The gold towels are a little cheesy around the resort but they do enforce the rule that only preferred guests can stay around the preferred pool. The bar palapa is nicely located beside the pool and includes large washroom facilities. There are three thatched palapas that keep out the rain even on windy occasions, but the light fabric covering the other loungers only wards off the sun, not the rain. The booze at the preferred bar is top shelf and I noticed that they keep the more expensive booze in the cupboards down below. I saw an English guy order Johnnie Walker Black with coke and the bartender did not blink an eye. 151 proof rum is available and I enjoyed raspberry flavoured Smirnoff and Bacardi Limon Rum. We did not notice any watered down drinks and if anything, we felt the drinks were too strong. Bar service around the pool is hit and miss, and our regular tipping did not seem to keep her coming back on a regular basis. The natural flow of drinks through the body allowed me plenty of opportunity to refresh my drink while I visited the facilities. The free Wi-Fi has adequate speed for our laptop but you have to go through a process to get access. At the coffee shop is an internet guy who will give you a 10 hour prepaid ticket that gives you a log in name and password. You get a voucher from the preferred lounge staff to take to the internet guy. If you run out in the morning or late at night, you have to wait for the guy to show up around 9 to 10am before you can get a new prepaid ticket for another 10 hour limit. The preferred lounge girls know that this system is a real pain, but Dreams does not want to change this system, even though most guests suggest the preferred lounge staff hold the prepaid tickets.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay at Dreams LR

reviews.text: My husband, 2 sons (24 and 17) and I spent Oct 23 - 31 at Dreams LaRomana. EVerything went smoothy the entire week. Two guys offered to help with our luggage and they whisked us right to the Apple check-in where they got the number of our van and escorted us directly to our bus. Well worth their tip!!! Traveling through Apple was great! They had recently started non-stop shuttle service to Dreams LaRomana so no stopping at 100 hotels to drop guests off along the way. The drive is rather long (90 min or so) and if you are prone to car sickness, a difficult ride. (The time will be cut in half when the new road is done but they said that will take about 2 years). Upon arrival at DReams we were taken to our building for check-in rather than checking in in the lobby - another perk of traveling through Apple. We were given champagne and cool cloths and check-in was efficient. Our rooms were clean and beautiful. Bedding was nice and beds were very comfortable. We ordered different pillows the 2nd night from the pillow menu - perfect! The grounds are clean and beautiful. The pools are amazing! The beach is clean and gorgeous. Beautiful sunsets!! We thought about upgrading to Preferred but didn't want to spend the extra money. We didn't need to. The resort is laid out beautifully and we were close to everything. Our boys went snorkeling by the pier and saw LOTS of fish!!
reviews.title: The week was a DREAM!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did purchase unlimited internet access so we coudl use our laptop in our room. We had trouble getting it to work and needed to make several trips to the business center. The person working the center eventually came to our room (it would work at the center but not in our room) and got things working!!
reviews.title: Honeymoon . . . .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Entertainment Team really enhanced our stay!! They were so much fun and so friendly. Not a day went by that Julio Coca-Cola didn't ask how we were doing or invite us to participate in something. Pablo Picasso was hysterical!! And Alex (while we loved them all, Alex really won our hearts!!) was just wonderful! Hard to put into words all the little and big things they did to make our vacation so wonderful but sometimes it felt like they were there for JUST US. We participated in a range of activities that the Entertainment team offered to earn resort "dollars" -- and to have fun. We went to a few of the shows and enjoyed them. My older son went to the casino a few times.
reviews.title: real dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and drinks were very good. The buffet was very nice (and we're really not buffet people). The supper buffet was actually so good that we decided to eat there a couple of times. Portifino, Bordeau, and El Patio were the other restaurants we tried. Very good. Excellent service. We also tried a few of the lunch places. We had breakfast in the buffet every day. My younger son also used room service and really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Enjoy and chill out

reviews.text: 3 of us had massages while we were there. Perfect!! Ask what the "special" is today and you will probably get $30 off!!
reviews.title: Best Vacation so far to DR

description: Time spent at Dreams La Romana Resort & Spa on the sun drenched southeast coast of the Dominican Republic is an unforgettable adventure for singles, couples and families. Here, you’ll discover a tranquil world that gives you one of nature’s most pristine beaches, a sea of vivid turquoise and most importantly, the special feeling of being welcomed as a most honored with all attendant privileges of Unlimited-Luxury® — where everything is included.You will be transformed by the calming power of the tropical jungle and palm lined beach that borders your vacation hideaway. Lounging by our large crystalline pools, or wandering among our tropical gardens, you’ll soon feel time and tension melt away. From the moment we greet your arrival, you will be delighted by your surroundings and service.
